title: Detect Pleiotropic SNPs — detect_pleiotropy
text: Identifies SNPs associated multiple traits GWAS data. SNP considered pleiotropic shows significant associations two distinct traits.

title: Detect Pleiotropic SNPs — detect_pleiotropy
text: gwas_data data.frame containing preprocessed GWAS summary statistics. traits Character vector. Specific traits analyze pleiotropy (default: NULL uses traits). pvalue_threshold Numeric. P-value threshold significance (default: 5e-8).

title: Detect Pleiotropic SNPs — detect_pleiotropy
text: data.table pleiotropic SNPs, associated traits,   significance levels.

title: Detect Pleiotropic SNPs — detect_pleiotropy
code: data(gwas_subset) pleio_results <- detect_pleiotropy(gwas_subset) head(pleio_results) #>          SNPS N_TRAITS                                  TRAITS #>        <char>    <int>                                  <char> #> 1: rs10182181        2    body mass index;tyrosine measurement #> 2: rs10182181        2    body mass index;tyrosine measurement #> 3:  rs2817462        2 memory performance;tyrosine measurement #> 4:  rs3739081        2      C-reactive protein;body mass index #> 5:  rs3739081        2      C-reactive protein;body mass index #> 6:     rs7412        2       Alzheimer disease;LDL cholesterol #>            MAPPED_TRAIT PVALUE_MLOG CHR_ID   CHR_POS #>                  <char>       <num> <char>    <char> #> 1:      body mass index    29.69897      2  24927427 #> 2: tyrosine measurement    11.69897      2  24927427 #> 3: tyrosine measurement     9.69897      6 156588550 #> 4:      body mass index     8.69897      2  26732753 #> 5:   C-reactive protein    11.00000      2  26732753 #> 6:    Alzheimer disease   122.39790     19  44919689  # Analyze specific traits specific_traits <- c("Alzheimer disease", "myocardial infarction") pleio_specific <- detect_pleiotropy(gwas_subset, traits = specific_traits)

title: Load GWAS Summary Statistics — load_gwas_data
text: Loads GWAS summary statistics file, supporting various formats. function automatically detects common separators handles standard GWAS file formats.

title: Load GWAS Summary Statistics — load_gwas_data
text: file_path Character. Path GWAS summary statistics file. sep Character. Field separator (default: "\t"). header Logical. Whether file contains header row (default: TRUE). quote Character. Quote character (default: "").

title: Load GWAS Summary Statistics — load_gwas_data
text: data.table containing GWAS summary statistics.

title: Load GWAS Summary Statistics — load_gwas_data
code: # \donttest{ # Load example data file_path <- system.file("extdata", "example_gwas.tsv", package = "pleior") if (file.exists(file_path)) {     gwas_data <- load_gwas_data(file_path)     head(gwas_data) } # }

title: Create Manhattan Plot for Pleiotropic SNPs — plot_pleiotropy_manhattan
text: pleio_data data.frame containing pleiotropy analysis results. highlight_snp Character. SNP identifier highlight (default: NULL). title Character. Plot title (default: "Manhattan Plot Pleiotropic SNPs").

title: Create Manhattan Plot for Pleiotropic SNPs — plot_pleiotropy_manhattan
text: ggplot2 object representing Manhattan plot.

title: Create Manhattan Plot for Pleiotropic SNPs — plot_pleiotropy_manhattan
code: data(gwas_subset) pleio_results <- detect_pleiotropy(gwas_subset) if (nrow(pleio_results) > 0) {     p <- plot_pleiotropy_manhattan(pleio_results, highlight_snp = "rs814573")     print(p) }

title: Preprocess GWAS Data — preprocess_gwas
text: Filters cleans GWAS summary statistics downstream pleiotropy analysis. Removes missing values, applies significance thresholds, standardizes column names.

title: Preprocess GWAS Data — preprocess_gwas
text: gwas_data data.frame containing GWAS summary statistics. pvalue_threshold Numeric. P-value threshold filtering (default: 5e-8). columns Character vector. Columns retain output (default: key GWAS columns).
